json.text:
Hello. Welcome to IELTS KILLER
The video series which gives you the best

ideas to use for your important IELTS Writing
Essay

Here is today’s challenge
Some people believe that tourists should accept

social & environmental responsibility
while others believe that tourists should

not accept any responsibility at al.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?

So, whether tourists should be responsible
for the environment

is what you have to decide now
I think you have the quick answer for this.

Be a tourist or not, we all should protect
our dear planet Earth

Now why should they?
The most obvious reason is that many tourist

destinations are endangered.
For example, rivers and lakes are severely

damaged by wrappers & plastic bottles. B/c
of the huge amount of garbage, no boating

can be done.
Moreover, the water smells so awful that no

one would get near.
If only the tourists were more careful & considerate,

time & money wouldn’t be wasted on the cleaning
up
and the environment wouldn’t be harmed

and you know what?
It’s really unfair to the locals when all

the valuable resources
like water & fuel are over-consumed by the

travelers.
I mean, think about it, the tourists enjoy

their stay in five star hotels,
lavish parties & 2 showers a day

while the locals are short of drinking water
& food. Who would want to welcome a guest

to their home if they were treated like this?
Besides, tourist entertainment like

water rafting
trekking

and boating
leaves a stress to the fragile ecosystem

For both the host country and tourists to
have a pleasant experience,

they need to adopt these solutions
First, all the visitors should have an environmentally

friendly mindset.
That is they treat the tourist destinations

with care,
and clean up after finishing their activities

themselves.
Second, the tourists can live with the locals

instead of five star hotels.
In this way, they can save a bunch of dollars
and have a unique educational traveling experience.

Remember, a good tourist is one who leaves
behind nothing, but footprint;
and takes away nothing, but photographs.

Thanks for watching this video
For more incredible IELTS Writing ideas

Subscribe to my channel
And check out my other videos
Good luck with your IELTS Exam
